html:
{{doc.company}}
To : {{doc.customer_name}} ({{doc.party_name}})

{{ frappe.format(doc.transaction_date, {'fieldtype': 'Date'}) }}

Dear Valued Customer,
ATLAS Elevator & Escalator is a recognized worldwide pioneer in the field of Trading, and elevator Engineering, who is popular for progressed innovation and predominant quality. Founded in 1996, ATLAS is a modernized and professional elevator manufacturer that have successfully implemented 2000+ projects across the Sultanate of Oman.

As a Leading brand names in Vertical Transportation System Manufacturer, ATLAS has always been storing all essential spare parts of its equipment for project implementation and maintenance services and for their customers in need. Also, ATLAS has been supplying the vital spare parts of elevator & escalator to other manufacturers based in Oman.

ATLAS has designed an intelligent software that enables the coordination of an effective response to any situation. Its latest Remote Monitoring System monitors your lifts 24 hours a day from its call center computer system. This means any kind of problem in your system will be detected, and an alert will be sent to the ATLAS’s call center. This dedicated 24 hour a day facility is ready to resolve any issue before it becomes a real problem.

We have strict processes and procedures in place that enhance site safety when we are working. We fully train all our engineering staff on effective health and safety behavior on site. At ATLAS Elevator & escalator, we keep our training and procedures under continual review, to ensure we are always following the most up-to-date and best practice.

We trust our explanation and offer will meet your expectations and requirements and looking forward to collaborating with you.

Thanking you and always assuring you of our best services.

Yours faithfully,
ATLAS Elevator & Escalator

Ramadan Offer

Quotation Machine Room Less ITALEX Elevator 8 P,630Kg

FIRST Party:
ATLAS Elevator & Escalator CO.
Location: Al Hail North

SECOND Party:
{{doc.customer_name}} ({{doc.party_name}})

The buyer has entered into an agreement with the ATLAS Elevator & Escalator, subject to the following terms and conditions of this contract.

Annexure-1: Price schedule and Warranties

Annexure-2: Job Description and Schedules

Annexure-3: Design and customization

Annexure-4: Standard and optional features

Annexure-5: Technical Specification

Annexure-6: Term and condition

This Agreement has both an English and Arabic version. ATLAS, will provide the second party any of these versions on his request.

This contract will be provided in two copies, with one party holding a copy to act on after signing it, and the second party agreeing to read all of the clauses.

After the second party signs this contract, he acknowledges everything expressed in this offer.

Annexure-1 : Price schedule and Warranties

However, if the installation is delayed due to any reason not related to Atlas, the final payment will be due within 60 days from the date of material ready for delivery.

We will need a local letter of credit that is irrevocable and confirmed for above b & c. Details can be discussed and agreed upon when the order is finalized.

It should be noted that the General conditions for delivery, installation, commissioning, and training are detailed in Annexure 5: Terms and condition.

Warranty

{% for wt in doc.warranty_table %} {% endfor %}
{{wt.warranty_type}} {{wt.warranty}}
The above-mentioned warranty will be in effect as of the date of handover. Machine Warranty is according to Atlas annual frequently service maintenance

AMC Charges Per\Lift (R.O)
{{doc.amc_charges}} {{doc.per_lift_r_o}}
Our equipment is guaranteed to be free from manufacturing defects and poor workmanship within 24 months from the date of installation or 27 months from the date of delivery (whichever occurs first)

Annexure-2: Job Description and Schedules

We require a clear 4-3 months’ time for mobilization / delivery of materials from the date of confirmed order / MAS approval / Receipt of advance payment / Drawing approval whichever is later.

Thereafter we will take 2 months’ time to substantially complete the installation subject to site readiness with all necessary builder’s works like Door & Rail, Machine & Cabin and electrical facilities in all respects as per our shop drawing at least 4 months prior to the completion period.

After the substantial completion of installation, we need a clear 2 weeks’ time to complete the testing & commissioning for each equipment subject to the availability of power supply 4 weeks before the completion period.

All components of the elevator other than specified elsewhere shall be sourced, manufactured & supplied as per manufacturer’s Global sourcing policy and shall be delivered to site within the above periods.

Annexure-3 Elevator Car Design & Specifications

Annexure-5 Technical Specifications

Annexure-6 Term and condition

1) Validity:

This agreement is valid from a period of one years from the date of signature. After the expiry of contract date, if the project price and dispatch terms must be renegotiated; if no agreement is reached in 90 days, termination clause is applicable.

2) Variation::

I. If a change in the scope of work or technical specifications is required, the buyer is responsible for the cost and time involved.

a. In case a frame is installed prior to completion of the floor, at the discretion of the Second Party, the latter shall incur with extra charges against amendment of any frame.

b. In case of replacement of frames in the second phase, the Second Party shall incur with extra charges against dismantle and installment of any frame.

II. The agreed amount is valued as per our estimation of costs in the meantime. In case of completion of installation of the elevator within four years, the said value shall be reviewed as per the foreign exchange rate or changes in international prices of the material.

III. In case after conclusion of the contract to build the elevator and inspection of the site, a difference in the number of stations or door system is identified, such as the corresponding door or angle, the value of the same shall be added to the Contract as per the noted difference.

3) Payment:

a.    In case the site is not ready to receive/accept the materials we shall be entitled to receive the amount as per above Payment Terms: 1)-b with materials off site. The materials will be delivered once the buyer confirms about the readiness of the site.

b.     After delivery of the materials to the site, ATLAS unable to begin installation or, having begun, but unable to continue uninterruptedly with the installation for reasons unrelated to ATLAS, the buyer shall be responsible for the safety and storage of the materials at his own expense.

c.     If the project is delayed/suspended, or approvals to drawings/equipment for reasons unrelated to ATLAS, then: The price increase will be applied to materials that have not been ordered or received.

d.     The price increase will also apply to labor for demobilization/remobilization.

e.     In case of failure or delay in payment, we are entitled to suspend works until recovery of the due payments, without any liability on the First Party.

4) TRAINING:

Your security staff will receive emergency evacuation training for the above equipment.

5) TAXES & DUTIES:

As of the date of agreement, the quoted prices include import duty. The buyer will be responsible for any increases in the current duty structure imposed by the government. Any additional taxes or levies imposed after the date of this agreement will be charged to the buyer at their current rates.

6) DISPUTES:

If there is a disagreement between the parties to this contract, it will be resolved in accordance with the rules and regulations in force in the Sultanate of Oman.

7) WORKS TO BE CARRIED OUT BY CLIENT :

The Owner shall conduct the following works:

a.     Build the elevator structure as per our layouts, in coordination with the Engineering Office supervising the construction works.

b.     Proper lockable and weather resistant storage space anywhere around the hoist way. If damage caused by pilferage or theft, after the material has been loaded on site and kept in a designated storage area assigned by the buyer, will be to the buyer's account.

c.     Conduct all concrete works, including construction of the main structure of the elevator and machine room that shall be on a flat and firm ground, with a minimum thickness of (20 cm), or install a steel rail to support the ceiling, in addition to a hoist way pit and ventilation openings. A hook should be provided at the center of the well on the roof.

d.    To furnish and install power, signal and light connections as follows:

          a.     A 3 phase 415 V 50 Hz Ac power supply with                   Isolator for each elevator at the top floor near                   the panel.

          b.     A single phase 240V 50 Hz AC auxiliary                   power supply with isolator for each elevator                   at the top floor near the panel as required.

          c.     A single phase 240V 50 Hz AC auxiliary                   power supply with isolator for each elevator                   at the top floor near the panel for hoist way                   lights and outlet in the hoist way as required.

e.     To furnish the Pit and overhead as to technical requirements mentioned on Contract. suitable drains, waterproofing and pit ladder.

f.    shaft painting works:

          a.     for normal Steel doors, the shaft will be                   painted white.

          b.     for glass doors, the shaft will be painted                   black.

g.    To furnish and erect shaft scaffolding to full height of the hoist way with safe working platform and dismantle after our works are over as required and other civil work whenever required.

h.     To furnish, at your expense during the erection of the elevator, electric power of the necessary characteristics to

i.    provide illumination, operation of required electric tools hoist, current for starting, testing and adjusting the elevator . Hoist way lighting with the cabling & conduiting as per our requirements.

j.    Develop Electricity and Telephone points at the machine room.

k.    Identify level of doors height.

l.    Upon completion of the first phase (rails + frames), finish the outer side of the doors using marble or surveyor.

m.    Install boundary bars, if necessary.

n.    Install air-conditioner at the machine room.

o.    The buyer shall be responsible for removal of scrap materials from the site.

2) OWNER OF MATERIAL

ATLAS will retain ownership of the materials until the buyer makes the complete payment under this contract.

a.     Any unused material remaining at the end of the work will remain the property of ATLAS.

b.     Also, ATLAS have the right to reclaim the materials provided.

c.     The elevator subject of the contract is considered the property of (Atlas Elevators Company) and it has the right Disposal of it and it is prohibited to operate it by any third party even if the ownership of the building is transferred to another party. Unless the value of the elevator is paid in full according to the terms of the payments Note: The installation is only done by complying with the terms of the payments and the completion of the preparatory work (concrete works).

3) TERMINATION OF CONTRACT

If the buyer cancels, ATLAS will charge the buyer the following fees:

a.     15% of the contract value is required, before drawing approval.

b.     30% of the contract value is required, after drawing approval.

c.     60% of the contract value is required, after notification of materials ready at the warehouse.

d.     90 percent of the contract value is required, after the material is dispatched but not installed,

e.     100% of the contract value is required, If the installation has already started.

4) RIGHT TO USE:

Buyer is not entitled to use the Elevator / escalator under any of the following circumstances:

a.     Any usage before the formal written handover letter to buyer from Atlas.

b.     Without making the full and final payment.

c.    Any unauthorized use or attempt of unauthorized use shall render the warranty and free maintenance period null and void at your own cost.

5) WARRANTY:

a.     All elevator components other than specified elsewhere must be sourced, manufactured, and supplied in accordance with ATLAS sourcing policy. Consumables include, but are not constrained to oil and grease, batteries, fasteners, bolts & nuts, paint, alteration of steel structure as per site conditions, electrical accessories shall be obtained locally whenever required.

b.     However, the warranty will be void if our equipment is misused, damaged, Water or burnt out due to excessive voltage fluctuations, or if repairs are made without our prior written consent.

c.    Maintenance contract is the main part of this agreement. If the Maintenance Service contract did not renew within 30 days, the second party will be deprived from the right of Warranty.

d.    The second party is not entitled to call a third party to carry out maintenance work for the elevator so as not to lose his right to Warranty.

e.    The emergency battery is not included in the warranty clause.

f.    In order to guarantee the rights of the client and company, all posters on the cabin and doors shall be removed, upon completion of installation of electricity phase. In case the client requests not to remove the posters, the client shall be responsible for any damage arises later out of removal of the same, without any liability on the part of our Company.

8) Force Majeure:

No delay or failure in performance by either party hereto shall constitute default hereunder or give rise to any claim for damages if, and to the extent, such delay or failure is caused by Force Majeure, as defined below.

a.    Act of God, Acts of War, Riots / Strikes, Any embargo, or blockade or trade sanction

b.    Any circumstance beyond the reasonable control of either of the parties.

Notes:

a.    Number of persons inside the elevator cabin fully depends on the size and dimension of the hoist way provided by the Second Party. The number of persons stated in this clause is the capacity of the engine provided by the First Party, noting that the size of cabin depends on the size of hoist way. The final size is approved upon completion of the first phase. In case of difference in the size of hoist way, the Company may not be obligated with the size stated in the Contract.

b.    Handover does not take place, except upon installation of air-conditioner and machine room door, in addition to installation of stairs, if necessary.

c.    Handover of the elevator shall not take place, except after inspection and completion of construction works.

d.    It is not an obligation to adhere to the size stated in the Contract by the Client, but rather the actual size of the elevator hoist way shall be adhered to. Accordingly, Door-opening and cabin sizes may be amended, without reference to the Second Party.

e.    In case the Client desires to increase the level of doors, and install a marble threshold, he shall notify the Company of the same, prior to installation of the mechanical works.

f.    Atlas will provide three engineering site visits in process of installation for both Owner and Contractor. In case of any additional site visit extra charges will be invoiced to 2nd party.
name: Quotation Pack
